usefulItems: tart tin (Ø 22 cm), cling film, oven, refrigerator
title: Key Lime Pie

ingredients.content: 140 g unsalted butter, diced, plus extra for greasing
2 limes, thin peelings of skin only

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 180°C. Grease base and sides of a tart tin (Ø 22 cm) generously with butter.
Place graham crackers and sugar in mixing bowl then crush <b>10 sec/speed 6<b>.
Add butter and mix <b>7 sec/speed 5<b>. Transfer to prepared tin. Use hands or a spoon to press crumb mixture firmly into base and up sides of tin to form an even, compact layer.
Bake for 10 minutes (180°C) then leave to cool in tin. Leave oven on to bake filling.
Place lime peel and sugar in mixing bowl then grind <b>40 sec/speed 10<b>. Transfer to a small bowl and set aside.
<b>Insert butterfly whisk<b>. Place egg yolks in mixing bowl and whisk <b>20 sec/speed 3<b>.
Without measuring cup, mix <b>2 min/speed 4<b> while slowly adding condensed milk through hole in mixing bowl lid.
Add lime juice and reserved lime sugar mixture then mix <b>30 sec/speed 4<b>. Pour pie filling into cooled base then bake for 15 minutes (180°C).
Leave to cool to room temperature, then cover with cling film and place in fridge for at least 4 hours before slicing and serving.

hintsAndTricks: Leftover egg whites can be used to make a meringue topping for the pie or for meringues.
To just cover base with crumb mix instead of base and sides, reduce graham crackers to <b>170 g<b> in <b>step 2<b> and butter to <b>100 g<b> in <b>step 3.<b>
Key lime pie can be topped with a dusting of icing sugar, whipped cream, caramel sauce, chocolate sauce or fruit coulis.
